trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when a <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.Ping.Send*"></xref> or <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.Ping.SendAsync*"></xref> method calls a method that throws an exception.

The <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.Ping> class throws this exception to indicate that while sending an Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Echo request, a method called by the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.Ping> class threw an unhandled exception.
Applications should check the inner exception of a <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PingException> object to identify the problem.
The <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.Ping> class does not throw this exception if the ICMP Echo request fails because of network, ICMP, or destination errors.

For such errors, the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.Ping> class returns a <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PingReply> object with the relevant <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPStatus> value set in the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PingReply.Status%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.PingException"></xref> class using the specified message.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property with the text in the `message` parameter.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that describes the error.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.PingException"></xref> class with serialized data.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute a previously serialized <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.PingException> object.
The object that holds the serialized object data.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that specifies the contextual information about the source or destination for this serialization.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.PingException"></xref> class using the specified message and inner exception.

This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property with the text in the `message` parameter, and the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property with the `innerException` parameter.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that describes the error.
The exception that causes the current exception.
